Package suga.engine.graphics

Interface GraphicsPanelInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Graphics2d, GraphicsPanel
public interface GraphicsPanelInterface
Implementations of GraphicsPanel likely need to extend JPanel so that they can be used to draw.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addImage(int x, int y, int width, int height, BufferedImage image)
    Adds the given image to the list of images to draw this frame.

    Adds the given image to the list of images to draw this frame.

    De-registers all draw listeners for this panel.

  • Method Details

    • drawing

      void drawing(int width, int height)
      Calls every program that would like add pixels to the panel before it's displayed.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the pixels that can be defined.
      height - The height of the pixels that can be defined.

    • setThread

      void setThread(SugaThread thread)
      Sets the thread that is calling repaint on this GraphicsPanel.
      Parameters:
      thread - The thread that will be calling repaint() on this object.

    • registerListener

      void registerListener(DrawListener listener)
      Adds the drawing listener to this instance.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to register.

    • registerListener

      void registerListener(DrawListener.Priorities priority, DrawListener listener)
      Adds the drawing listener to this instance with the given priority.
      Parameters:
      priority - The priority to register the listener at.
      listener - The listener to register.

    • clearListeners

      void clearListeners()
      De-registers all draw listeners for this panel. New ones need to be added with registerListener(DrawListener).

    • setPixel

      void setPixel(int x, int y, Color c)
      Used to set the values of pixels.
      Parameters:
      x - The x to set.
      y - The y to set.
      c - The color to set the pixel to.

    • setRectangle

      void setRectangle(int x, int y, int width, int height, Color c)
      Used to create a rectangle of pixels assigned to a particular color.
      Parameters:
      x - The top left most corner of the rectangle.
      y - The top left most corner of the rectangle.
      width - How wide the rectangle is.
      height - How tall the rectangle is.
      c - The color to set the rectangle to.

    • setBigPixel

      void setBigPixel(int x, int y, int r, Color c)
      Used to set a block of pixels with the given radius.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position to center this 'big pixel'.
      y - The y position to center this 'big pixel'.
      r - The radius of this 'big pixel'.
      c - The color to set these pixels to.

    • addImage

      void addImage(int x, int y, int width, int height, String path)
      Adds the given image to the list of images to draw this frame. Attempts to load an image from resources.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of this image.
      y - The y position of this image.
      width - The width of this image.
      height - The height of this image.
      path - The path of the image to draw on screen.

    • addImage

      void addImage(int x, int y, int width, int height, BufferedImage image)
      Adds the given image to the list of images to draw this frame.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of this image.
      y - The y position of this image.
      width - The width of this image.
      height - The height of this image.
      image - The image to draw to the screen.
